verses.roman:
tad ākarṇyeśvarau rājann
anusṛtya nṛ-lokatām
aho naḥ paramaṁ kaṣṭam
ity asrākṣau vilepatuḥ

synonyms: tat—that; ākarṇya—hearing; īśvarau—the two Lords; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); anusṛtya—imitating; nṛ-lokatām—the way of human society; aho—alas; naḥ—for Us; paramam—the greatest; kaṣṭam—distress; iti—thus; asra—tearful; akṣau—whose eyes; vilepatuḥ—They both lamented.
translation: When Lord Kṛṣṇa and Lord Balarāma heard this news, O King, They exclaimed, "Alas! This is the greatest tragedy for Us! "Thus imitating the ways of human society, They lamented, Their eyes brimming with tears.
